Document.author: scrappy
Document.document: From: Michael Meskes <meskes@topsystem.de> Tue Apr 28 14:48:41 CEST 1998 - Put operator "->" back into parser. Note that :foo->bar means the C term, but :foo ->bar means the operator "->". Tue Apr 28 15:49:07 CEST 1998 - Added exec sql disconnect command. - Allow varchar in C to be written in uppercase too. - Added whenever option "do breakSEMICOLON" Wed Apr 29 09:17:53 CEST 1998 - Corrected parsing of C comments. - Also allow C++ style comments. - Make sure not found is only checked after commands that could return it. - Added error codes, see ecpgerror.h for details. - Added "exec sql <TransactionStmt> release" as disconnect statement for compatibility issues. Thu Apr 30 10:42:10 CEST 1998 - Added a -t option to disable automatic transaction start. - Added sqlerrd[] to sqlca struct. - Give back number of tuples affect in sqlca.sqlerrd[2]. Thu Apr 30 13:36:02 CEST 1998 - Make the return code different in case of different errors. Wed May 6 11:42:48 CEST 1998 - Free memory if possible - Some bugfixes for bugs I found while changing the memory allocation code - Now able to fill complete array with one call (see test1.pgc for an example) - Set version to 2.3.0 - Set library version to 2.1

Document.author: scrappy

Tue Apr 28 15:49:07 CEST 1998 - Added exec sql disconnect command. - Allow varchar in C to be written in uppercase too. - Added whenever option "do breakSEMICOLON" Wed Apr 29 09:17:53 CEST 1998 - Corrected parsing of C comments. - Also allow C++ style comments. - Make sure not found is only checked after commands that could return it. - Added error codes, see ecpgerror.h for details. - Added "exec sql <TransactionStmt> release" as disconnect statement for compatibility issues. Thu Apr 30 10:42:10 CEST 1998 - Added a -t option to disable automatic transaction start. - Added sqlerrd[] to sqlca struct. - Give back number of tuples affect in sqlca.sqlerrd[2]. Thu Apr 30 13:36:02 CEST 1998 - Make the return code different in case of different errors. Wed May 6 11:42:48 CEST 1998 - Free memory if possible - Some bugfixes for bugs I found while changing the memory allocation code - Now able to fill complete array with one call (see test1.pgc for an example) - Set version to 2.3.0 - Set library version to 2.1

Note that :foo->bar means the C term, but :foo ->bar means the operator "->". Tue Apr 28 15:49:07 CEST 1998 - Added exec sql disconnect command. - Allow varchar in C to be written in uppercase too. - Added whenever option "do breakSEMICOLON" Wed Apr 29 09:17:53 CEST 1998 - Corrected parsing of C comments. - Also allow C++ style comments. - Make sure not found is only checked after commands that could return it. - Added error codes, see ecpgerror.h for details. - Added "exec sql <TransactionStmt> release" as disconnect statement for compatibility issues. Thu Apr 30 10:42:10 CEST 1998 - Added a -t option to disable automatic transaction start. - Added sqlerrd[] to sqlca struct. - Give back number of tuples affect in sqlca.sqlerrd[2]. Wed May 6 11:42:48 CEST 1998 - Free memory if possible - Some bugfixes for bugs I found while changing the memory allocation code - Now able to fill complete array with one call (see test1.pgc for an example) - Set version to 2.3.0 - Set library version to 2.1

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove extra paren in __alpha so it compiles.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: What I've done: 1. Rewritten libpq to allow asynchronous clients. 2. Implemented client side of cancel protocol in library, and patched psql.c to send a cancel request upon SIGINT. The backend doesn't notice it yet :-( 3. Implemented 'Z' protocol message addition and renaming of copy in/out start messages. These are implemented conditionally, ie, the client protocol version is checkedSEMICOLON so the code should still work with 1.0 clients. 4. Revised protocol and libpq sgml documents (don't have an SGML compiler, though, so there may be some markup glitches here). What remains to be done: 1. Implement addition of atttypmod field to RowDescriptor messages. The client-side code is there but ifdef'd out. I have no idea what to change on the backend side. The field should be sent only if protocol >= 2.0, of course. 2. Implement backend response to cancel requests received as OOB messages. (This prolly need not be conditional on protocol versionSEMICOLON just do it if you get SIGURG.) 3. Update libpq.3. (I'm hoping this can be generated mechanically from libpq.sgml... if not, will do it by hand.) Is there any other doco to fix? 4. Update non-libpq interfaces as necessary. I patched libpgtcl so that it would compile, but haven't tested it. Dunno what needs to be done with the other interfaces. Have at it! Tom Lane

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: It seems the regression tests don't cover copy in/out at all, so code that I had assumed was working had not been tested. Naturally, it was broken ... Tom Lane

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Minor markup change.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Allow building a source tarball. Try to generalize the gzip/tar usage for more portability.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Define "tz_hour" and "tz_minute" arguments to date_part(). Fix up "ISO-style" timespan decoding and encoding.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Make a few line routines visible. Incorporate patches from Gautam for line/point intersection.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Add routines to convert between varchar and bpchar. Add routines to allow sizing of varchar and bpchar into target columns.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Add bit flags to support timezonehour and minute in data retrieval.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Make lines more visible to the user.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Add routines to convert between varchar and bpchar. Add routines to allow sizing of varchar and bpchar into target columns.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Make lines and support routines/operators more visible. Add #define's for remaining "builtin" types.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Allow more variations on valid floating point numbers (e.g. ".1", "1e6"). Reintroduce fixes for unary minus parsing with leading spaces.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Implement TIMEZONE_HOUR, TIMEZONE_MINUTE per SQL92 specs. Check for and properly ignore FOREIGN KEY column constraints (already had fixed same for table constraints). Define USER as synonym for CURRENT_USER per SQL92 specs (no longer allowed as bare column name, sorry). Re-enable HAVING clause but no fixes elsewhere yet. Make "char" type a synonum for "char(1)" (actually implemented as bpchar). Compress/compact row-style subselect and operator definitions (cut out ~140 lines of code with no change in functionality). Save string type if specified for DEFAULT clause handling. Enough for now...

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Add parse_coerce.c for type conversion handling.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Implement TIMEZONE_HOUR, TIMEZONE_MINUTE per SQL92 specs. Check for and properly ignore FOREIGN KEY column constraints (already had fixed same for table constraints). Define USER as synonym for CURRENT_USER per SQL92 specs (no longer allowed as bare column name, sorry). Re-enable HAVING clause but no fixes elsewhere yet. Other stuff from today's update of gram.y...

Document.document: Someone remove a #define too much from pg_proc.h which breaks compiling nbtsearch.c after configuring with --enable-cassert. Patch below. -- --------------------------------------------- Göran Thyni, sysadm, JMS Bildbasen, Kiruna

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Cleanups for large objects, so file is trucated on open, fix for solaris/spare shared libararies, new error message for postmaster startup, and makefile cleanups.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Give proper error on psql BACKSLASHcopy use.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: The attached patch corrects two problems with autoconfiguration of psql in Postgres 6.3.2. Both of these problems were complained of recently in pgsql-questions: 1. In the right circumstances, psql.c will fail to compile due to trying to include a nonexistent <history.h>. (Thread "Compile-time error" around 17 Apr 98.) 2. In other circumstances, psql will compile but does not provide command history capability, even though the underlying readline library supports it. (Various threads, most recently "query repetition in psql" around 29 Apr.) Tom Lane

Document.author: scrappy
Document.document: From: Michael Meskes <meskes@topsystem.de> + + Wed May 6 16:09:45 CEST 1998 + + - Some more cleanups in the library. + + Thu May 7 12:34:28 CEST 1998 + + - Made CONNECT and DISCONNECT statement more SQL3 compliant. + - Changed the API for the ECPGconnect function to be able to handle + hostnames and ports + + Fri May 8 13:54:45 CEST 1998 + - More changes to the parser. The connect statement now allows + ORACLE style logins. + - db-name is accepted in two ways: + - <dbname>[@<server>][:<port>] + - esql:postgresql://<server>[:<port>][/<dbname>] + + Mon May 11 10:28:37 CEST 1998 + + - Added '? options' to connect call. + - Also allow USING as keyword for the password + + Thu May 14 15:09:58 CEST 1998 + + - Changed preproc.y and pgc.l according to the parser changes in the + backend. + + Fri May 15 09:55:21 CEST 1998 + + - Added connection_name handling + + + Mon May 18 10:33:58 CEST 1998 + + - Fixed some more bugs + - Set version to 2.3.1 + - Set library version to 2.2

Document.author: scrappy
Document.document: From: Brook Milligan <brook@trillium.NMSU.Edu> Everything (except of course random) passes on my netbsd box except int2, int4, oidint2, and oidint4SEMICOLON all fail because of error message differences. Below are some patches to the expectations to correct the problem by creating *-NetBSD.out files.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Define PGDOC to use POSTGRESDIR by default. Can be set to something else in Makefile.custom if necessary.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Clarify ownership and security issues with alternate db locations.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Add test for UNION. Add additional tests in strings for conversions of the "name" data type. Test SQL92 string functions such as SUBSTRING() and POSITION(). Fix geometry tests to reflect code fixed by Gautam. Update error messages.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Add test for UNION. Add additional tests in strings for conversions of the "name" data type. Test SQL92 string functions such as SUBSTRING() and POSITION().

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Ensure string is completely null padded on input (as advertised).

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Add conversion functions to and from the "name" data type.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Add conversion functions between "name" and other string types.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Add conversion functions between "name" and other string types.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Fix up a couple of comments broken by the automatic indenting process.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Require #define variable ALLOW_ABSOLUTE_DBPATHS if absolute paths are allowed to be used for alternate database locations. Probably best to default to not allowed, as now, since there are security and integrity issues which should be considered carefully before opening things up. Will update docs to discuss this issue.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Do type conversion to match columns in UNION clauses. Currently force the type to match the _first_ select in the union. Move oper_select_candidate() from parse_func.c to parse_oper.c. Throw error inside of oper_inexact() if no match for binary operators. Check more carefully that types can be coerced even if there is only one candidate operator in oper_inexact(). Fix up error messages for more uniform look. Remove unused code. Fix up comments.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Add NAMEOID as built-in type. Change ordering of IS_BUILTIN_TYPE() macro to optimize lookup. Make CASH type _not_ equivalent to INT4. CASH is passed by reference rather than passed by value.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Add func_select_candidate() to allow use in unary operator parsing.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Define new routines oper_exact() and oper_inexact(). Add coerce_target_expr().

Document.document: Remove fork()/exec() and only do fork(). Small cleanups.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: What I've done: 1. Rewritten libpq to allow asynchronous clients. 2. Implemented client side of cancel protocol in library, and patched psql.c to send a cancel request upon SIGINT. The backend doesn't notice it yet :-( 3. Implemented 'Z' protocol message addition and renaming of copy in/out start messages. These are implemented conditionally, ie, the client protocol version is checkedSEMICOLON so the code should still work with 1.0 clients. 4. Revised protocol and libpq sgml documents (don't have an SGML compiler, though, so there may be some markup glitches here). What remains to be done: 1. Implement addition of atttypmod field to RowDescriptor messages. The client-side code is there but ifdef'd out. I have no idea what to change on the backend side. The field should be sent only if protocol >= 2.0, of course. 2. Implement backend response to cancel requests received as OOB messages. (This prolly need not be conditional on protocol versionSEMICOLON just do it if you get SIGURG.) 3. Update libpq.3. (I'm hoping this can be generated mechanically from libpq.sgml... if not, will do it by hand.) Is there any other doco to fix? 4. Update non-libpq interfaces as necessary. I patched libpgtcl so that it would compile, but haven't tested it. Dunno what needs to be done with the other interfaces. Have at it! Tom Lane

Document.document: Add sys/time.h to fe-misc.c, prevent pgtclsh from using old libaries, and allow CUSTOM_COPT to appear in compile AND LINK commands.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Make a few line routines visible. Incorporate patches from Gautam for line/point intersection.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add missing includes.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add missing file from Tom Lane.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Add func_select_candidate() to allow use in unary operator parsing.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Allow cancel from client of backend query. Change some int variables to bool's.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Changed error message slightly.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Add capabilities for automatic type conversion.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Add capabilities for automatic type conversion.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Minor markup change.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Cleanup.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Another BACKSLASHfBACKSLASH fix for psql.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix to allow BACKSLASHf BACKSLASH to make spaces as delimiter.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Someone remove a #define too much from pg_proc.h which breaks compiling nbtsearch.c after configuring with --enable-cassert. Patch below. -- --------------------------------------------- Göran Thyni, sysadm, JMS Bildbasen, Kiruna

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Allow building a source tarball. Try to generalize the gzip/tar usage for more portability.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: cleanup.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: postmaster/postgres options cleanup.

Document.author: scrappy
Document.document: From: Tom Lane <tgl@sss.pgh.pa.us> ... which causes it to build and install the shared version of libpgtcl under the wrong name, on HPUX only. Patch against today's sources follows.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: First changes for reference pages. Fix markup in the docguide.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Define "tz_hour" and "tz_minute" arguments to date_part(). Fix up "ISO-style" timespan decoding and encoding.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Add conversion functions between "name" and other string types.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Add conversion functions between "name" and other string types.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Add conversion functions to and from the "name" data type.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Make lines and support routines/operators more visible. Add #define's for remaining "builtin" types.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Add routines to convert between varchar and bpchar. Add routines to allow sizing of varchar and bpchar into target columns.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Add routines to convert between varchar and bpchar. Add routines to allow sizing of varchar and bpchar into target columns.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Add TIMEZONE_HOUR, TIMEZONE_MINUTE keywords per SQL92 specs.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Implement TIMEZONE_HOUR, TIMEZONE_MINUTE per SQL92 specs. Check for and properly ignore FOREIGN KEY column constraints (already had fixed same for table constraints). Define USER as synonym for CURRENT_USER per SQL92 specs (no longer allowed as bare column name, sorry). Re-enable HAVING clause but no fixes elsewhere yet. Other stuff from today's update of gram.y...

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Implement TIMEZONE_HOUR, TIMEZONE_MINUTE per SQL92 specs. Check for and properly ignore FOREIGN KEY column constraints (already had fixed same for table constraints). Define USER as synonym for CURRENT_USER per SQL92 specs (no longer allowed as bare column name, sorry). Re-enable HAVING clause but no fixes elsewhere yet. Make "char" type a synonum for "char(1)" (actually implemented as bpchar). Compress/compact row-style subselect and operator definitions (cut out ~140 lines of code with no change in functionality). Save string type if specified for DEFAULT clause handling. Enough for now...

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Define new routines oper_exact() and oper_inexact(). Add coerce_target_expr().

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Do type conversion to match columns in UNION clauses. Currently force the type to match the _first_ select in the union. Move oper_select_candidate() from parse_func.c to parse_oper.c. Throw error inside of oper_inexact() if no match for binary operators. Check more carefully that types can be coerced even if there is only one candidate operator in oper_inexact(). Fix up error messages for more uniform look. Remove unused code. Fix up comments.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove added NullProc define, and use fmgr.h value from fmgr.h.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Cleanups for large objects, so file is trucated on open, fix for solaris/spare shared libararies, new error message for postmaster startup, and makefile cleanups.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Add parse_coerce.c for type conversion handling.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Clean up pg_hba.conf

Document.author: scrappy
Document.document: From: Brook Milligan <brook@trillium.NMSU.Edu> Everything (except of course random) passes on my netbsd box except int2, int4, oidint2, and oidint4SEMICOLON all fail because of error message differences. Below are some patches to the expectations to correct the problem by creating *-NetBSD.out files.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Add some more node print routines for debugging only (inside of #ifdef PARSEDEBUG blocks).

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Require #define variable ALLOW_ABSOLUTE_DBPATHS if absolute paths are allowed to be used for alternate database locations. Probably best to default to not allowed, as now, since there are security and integrity issues which should be considered carefully before opening things up. Will update docs to discuss this issue.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Move FAQ_DEV to docs directory, where it belongs.

Document.author: scrappy
Document.document: From: "Aldrin L." <aldrin@americasnet.com> Subject: [INTERFACES] mSQL Compatibility Library (fwd)

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Remove extraneous -DPARSEDEBUG from CFLAGS options.

Document.author: scrappy
Document.document: Add a check for DBL_MIN problem...not sure if this is right...needs testing...

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Define PGDOC to use POSTGRESDIR by default. Can be set to something else in Makefile.custom if necessary.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix for drop database and junk filters.

Document.author: scrappy
Document.document: From: Michael Meskes <meskes@topsystem.de> + + Wed May 6 16:09:45 CEST 1998 + + - Some more cleanups in the library. + + Thu May 7 12:34:28 CEST 1998 + + - Made CONNECT and DISCONNECT statement more SQL3 compliant. + - Changed the API for the ECPGconnect function to be able to handle + hostnames and ports + + Fri May 8 13:54:45 CEST 1998 + - More changes to the parser. The connect statement now allows + ORACLE style logins. + - db-name is accepted in two ways: + - <dbname>[@<server>][:<port>] + - esql:postgresql://<server>[:<port>][/<dbname>] + + Mon May 11 10:28:37 CEST 1998 + + - Added '? options' to connect call. + - Also allow USING as keyword for the password + + Thu May 14 15:09:58 CEST 1998 + + - Changed preproc.y and pgc.l according to the parser changes in the + backend. + + Fri May 15 09:55:21 CEST 1998 + + - Added connection_name handling + + + Mon May 18 10:33:58 CEST 1998 + + - Fixed some more bugs + - Set version to 2.3.1 + - Set library version to 2.2
